str2: The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Autumn, autumnal fruits. Apparently from the base of opse and hora; properly, even-tide of the season, i.e. ripe fruit.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
From psucho; breath, i.e. spirit, abstractly or concretely.
Desire, eagerness for, inordinate desire, lust. From epithumeo; a longing.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From apo and erchomai; to go off, aside or behind, literally or figuratively.
From, away from. A primary particle; 'off, ' i.e. Away, in various senses.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
(lit: fat), rich, sumptuous. From lipos; fat, i.e. sumptuous.
From the same as lampas; radiant; by analogy, limpid; figuratively, magnificent or sumptuous.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From apo and the base of olethros; to destroy fully, literally or figuratively.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: A prolonged form of a primary heuro, which heureo is used for it in all the tenses except the present and imperfect to find.
No longer, no more. Also ouk eti from ou and eti; not yet, no longer.
